title: Karur stampede: Scattered shoes, torn flags - aftermath shows how celebration ended in tragedy
content: A stampede at TVK chief Vijay's mega rally tragically claimed 40 and injured many. The chaotic aftermath left the venue in disarray, stunning locals. While Vijay expressed sorrow, the Chief Minister visited victims, as questions emerged regarding overcrowding and venue suitability.

title: Molestation case: 'Godman' Chaityananda Saraswati sent to 5-day police custody; probe on
content: A Delhi court sent Partha Sarthy alias Chaityananda Saraswati to five-day police custody for allegedly molesting female students and forgery. The former institute chairman exploited EWS students by confiscating phones and certificates, and diverted funds through a fraudulent trust. His anticipatory bail was rejected, and more victims are now coming forward.

title: Asia Cup: SKY snubs final photoshoot; Pak captain poses alone
content: India's captain Suryakumar Yadav skipped the Asia Cup 2025 final trophy photoshoot, leaving Pakistan skipper Salman Ali Agha to pose alone. Agha downplayed the incident, emphasizing his team's focus on cricket, adapting strategy to conditions, and reducing mistakes. Despite losing both previous encounters to India, Pakistan aims for victory in the highly anticipated final clash.

title: Google's ex-CEO raises 'China alarm', tells American tech firms: Remember, we’re …
content: Former Google CEO Eric Schmidt has again cautioned US tech giants against flexible remote working, citing China's demanding "996" culture as a competitive threat. He argues remote work hinders innovation and young employees' development. Schmidt's concerns align with Google's own policy shift, as co-founder Sergey Brin now urges AI teams to work in-office, even suggesting 60-hour weeks for optimal productivity.

title: Ind vs Pak: New twist! Two different broadcasters at the toss for both captains
content: The India-Pakistan Asia Cup final introduces a unique two-broadcaster toss, yet Pakistan's controversial media management dominates headlines. Their team has repeatedly avoided Indian journalists, skipping press conferences and restricting questions. This communication approach, amidst on-field struggles, has drawn sharp criticism, contrasting with India's open engagement. The PCB's vague response further fuels the controversy.

title: 'India has self-respect': Russia on Delhi's response over US oil pressure; 'no threat' to ties
content: Russia firmly defended India’s continued oil purchases despite US pressure, praising New Delhi’s “self-respect” and strong partnership. Foreign Minister Lavrov stated India’s energy choices are its own business, unaffected by US influence, and reiterated that India chooses its partners. He affirmed the robust, long-standing strategic ties between the two nations.

title: Accenture CEO on US’ H-1B visa policy: $100K fees non issue; India workforce key
content: Accenture CEO Julie Sweet downplayed the new $100,000 H-1B visa fee, stating it poses minimal threat due to the company's low reliance on the program. Sweet views the policy change as a business opportunity, anticipating increased client demand for compliance navigation. This perspective follows Accenture's strong fourth-quarter financial results.

title: Face-off at Kerala governor's event: Vijayan slams over journal; Tharoor suggests renaming office
content: Kerala's Raj Bhavan journal launch became a political flashpoint. CM Pinarayi Vijayan criticised an article in 'Rajhamsa' for not reflecting government views, while Shashi Tharoor suggested renaming 'Raj Bhavan' to 'Lok Bhavan'. Governor Arlekar defended the journal's open platform and welcomed the renaming idea, acknowledging past controversies surrounding his office.

title: Missing lawyers & witnesses: Why are 5.3cr cases pending in Indian courts? Key reasons
content: The Supreme Court recently underscored speedy trial as an unimpeachable right amidst 5.34 crore pending cases nationwide. Key reasons for delays include unavailable counsels, absconding accused, and missing witnesses. The SC directed High Courts to ensure trials are not adjourned for counsel absence and proceed day-to-day, criticizing trial courts for flouting this mandate.

title: H-1B visa fees hike: Startup CEO challenges move; claims it will favour tech firms
content: Box CEO Aaron Levie has strongly criticised President Trump's new $100,000 H-1B visa fee, warning it grants large tech companies an unfair advantage over cash-strapped startups in the global talent acquisition race. Levie argued the steep cost transforms international hiring into a 'spending game' smaller firms cannot win, potentially pushing innovation overseas. He advocated for a significantly lower $20,000 fee and a broader reform framework with flexible visa caps, aiming to attract top global talent while safeguarding American wages.

title: Asia Cup final: No place for key all-rounder in India playing XI vs Pakistan?
content: Former Indian wicketkeeper Parthiv Patel revealed his preferred playing XI for India's Asia Cup 2025 final against Pakistan, advocating for six bowling options. He notably dropped Shivam Dube for Arshdeep Singh, emphasizing bowling strength. Patel's lineup features batting depth and includes key players like Shubman Gill, whom he tipped as a potential match-winner. Hardik Pandya's injury could alter plans.

title: Asia Cup final: Ex-cricketer’s simple advice; tells India to 'win the powerplay'
content: Former cricketer Aakash Chopra advises India to dominate the powerplay against arch-rivals Pakistan in the Asia Cup 2025 final. He emphasises that an early advantage will secure the match, noting Pakistan's inability to recover from a poor start and their batting struggles. Chopra also warned about Shaheen Afridi's ineffectiveness without new ball wickets.

title: India-born cheetah at Kuno becomes adult on Monday- why it matters
content: India's cheetah reintroduction program will achieve a historic milestone as Mukhi, an India-born cub, reaches adulthood at Kuno National Park on Monday. Her survival, despite siblings' deaths, underscores the project's success, with Kuno's cub survival rate exceeding 61%. Officials plan to expand the gene pool, proving cheetahs can thrive and reproduce in Indian conditions.

title: Who is Jack Bech’s girlfriend? Meet Kylie Young, Raiders rookie’s supporter
content: Kylie Young, girlfriend of Raiders rookie Jack Bech, has emerged as a prominent influencer, skillfully balancing her personal brand with unwavering support for his NFL journey. Transitioning from Alabama to Las Vegas, she showcases a stylish and grounded presence, sharing glimpses of their affectionate relationship and her lifestyle content. Young champions Bech both on and off the field.

title: OpenAI CEO warns AI could replace 40% of jobs: Is yours on the list?
content: OpenAI CEO Sam Altman warns that AI could soon replace 30–40% of tasks across the economy, reshaping jobs from customer support to programming. Speaking in Berlin, he predicted superintelligent AI by 2030, urging workers to focus on adaptability, lifelong learning, and creativity. Altman stressed both risks and opportunities, framing AI as a transformative but manageable force for society.

title: Asia Cup: India player slammed after flop show; called out for 'filmy gimmicks'
content: Harshit Rana struggled in his return to the Indian team against Sri Lanka, conceding 54 runs and drawing criticism from former selector Srikkanth for his "filmy gimmicks." Srikkanth lauded the magical spin bowling of Kuldeep Yadav and Varun Chakravarthy. Bowling coach Morne Morkel acknowledged the rustiness of Rana and Arshdeep Singh, attributing it to a lack of game time.

title: Ind vs Pak final: Raut's 'nationalism' question; claims public unwilling to watch match
content: Shiv Sena (UBT) MP Sanjay Raut questioned nationalism ahead of the India-Pakistan Asia Cup 2025 final, arguing the match should not proceed due to recent terror attacks. He stated playing cricket with Pakistan contradicts India's stance on terrorism, claiming public sentiment opposes it and money drives the decision. Raut also criticized the BJP for allowing the series.

title: 'Stop the killing': Rahul says 'Ladakh under attack by RSS'; backs 6th Schedule
content: Rahul Gandhi criticized the BJP-led central government following violent protests in Ladakh that resulted in four deaths and the arrest of climate activist Sonam Wangchuk. Wangchuk was detained after demanding statehood and Sixth Schedule protection, with the MHA attributing the violence to his "provocative" speeches. Gandhi urged an end to the violence and demanded statehood for Ladakh.

title: Avika Gor-Milind Chandwani’s mehendi: Actress gets her in-laws’ names written on her hand
content: Avika Gor and Milind Chandwani, currently seen on 'Pati Patni Aur Panga', are celebrating their wedding festivities. During her mehendi ceremony, Avika made a heartwarming gesture by inscribing not only Milind's name but also her in-laws' and family members' names on her palms, leaving everyone stunned.

title: Gaza crisis: 66,000 killed, thousands wounded; what health ministry's new report says
content: Gaza's health ministry reports a staggering 66,000 killed and over 68,000 wounded in the Israel-Hamas war, with women and children comprising half the fatalities. The conflict, triggered by Hamas's October 7 attack, has devastated Gaza, creating a severe humanitarian crisis. Israel continues its offensive, while a US-backed plan proposes making Gaza a "terror-free zone" by removing Hamas.

title: Kohli's latest post crosses 10m likes in less than 24 hrs: why is it so special?
content: Virat Kohli's Instagram post with Anushka Sharma created a stir. The photograph showed a moment. It received over five million likes in two hours. It did not cross the ten million mark within 24 hours. The couple remains a duo. They were seen in London with their son Akaay. Their posts draw attention.

title: Taylor Swift leaves Selena’s wedding early to join Travis Kelce before game
content: Taylor Swift attended Selena Gomez's wedding in California. She then flew to Kansas City. Swift supported her fiancé Travis Kelce. He had a game against the Baltimore Ravens. This trip showed her commitment to both friends and romance. She left the wedding late Saturday night. Her private jet landed in Missouri with hours to spare.

title: Asia Cup: India vs Pak pitch for final revealed - here's how it fared in the past
content: The stage is set for a blockbuster Asia Cup 2025 final between unbeaten India and Pakistan in Dubai, on the very pitch where India decisively won their previous encounter. With India's top order in formidable form, the question looms whether history will repeat on the batting-friendly surface.

title: Black lives matter fallout: FBI agents photographed kneeling during Floyd protests fired
content: The FBI has reportedly dismissed approximately 20 agents who were photographed kneeling during 2020 racial justice demonstrations. These firings are part of a wider personnel shake-up under Director Kash Patel, which also saw the removal of agents involved in high-profile investigations, including those concerning former President Trump.

title: BCCI AGM: Mithun Manhas elected new president; Rajeev Shukla stays on as VP
content: Former Delhi captain Mithun Manhas was elected the 37th president of the BCCI at its Annual General Meeting, succeeding Roger Binny. The 45-year-old, a seasoned domestic cricketer with a formidable playing record, emerged as a consensus choice backed by the JKCA. He becomes only the third former cricketer to occupy the board's top chair.

title: Trump targets 100,000 Indian OPT students in US with rising site visits
content: The Trump administration has increased unannounced site visits for nearly 100,000 Indian students on the OPT programme in the US, particularly those on STEM-OPT extensions. USCIS and ICE officers are inspecting both workplaces and student residences to verify compliance with visa regulations. Attorneys report a rise in Requests for Evidence (RFEs) and advise students and employers to maintain accurate records and promptly update employment or address changes to avoid jeopardising F-1 visa status.

title: 'We need to fix India': Trump aide urges New Delhi to 'avoid policies that harm US'
content: Donald Trump's commerce secretary, Howard Lutnick, stated India must react correctly to the United States. He said India needs to open its markets and avoid policies harming the US. Lutnick asserted that India must play ball with the US president for access to American consumers. These remarks followed a high-level Indian delegation visit to the US for trade talks.

title: Delhi on alert: Bomb threat email sent to airport, schools; probe launched
content: Delhi Police received an email bomb threat targeting the city's airport, schools, and other institutions. An investigation has been initiated to verify the threat's credibility. The sender identified as 'Terrorizers 111'. Earlier, two schools received similar emails which were later confirmed as hoaxes. Recent bomb threats to various educational institutions and government offices were also found to be fake.

title: Josh Allen to play vs. Saints today; Bills QB injury-free and ready
content: Josh Allen is confirmed active and fully healthy for the Buffalo Bills' Week 4 matchup against the New Orleans Saints. He will lead the offense with no limitations, leveraging his dual-threat capabilities. Allen has started the 2025 season strong, accumulating 755 passing yards and five touchdowns without an interception in three games.

title: Chhattisgarh: 3 Naxals killed in encounter; gunfight broke out in Ravas forest
content: Three Naxals were killed on Sunday in an encounter with security forces in Chhattisgarh’s Kanker district. The exchange of fire took place in the Ravas forests, near the Kanker and Gariaband border, during an anti-Naxal operation. A joint team, including District Reserve Guard personnel from both districts, successfully neutralised the insurgents, marking a significant development in ongoing efforts.

title: Trump as ‘demon’, decapitated head of Pak PM: Durga Puja gets a twist
content: A West Bengal Durga Puja committee unveiled an asura idol resembling Donald Trump, citing his H-1B visa proclamation as a "betrayal." This move reflects widespread anxiety among Indian and NRI Bengali communities in the US, whose Durga Puja preparations were disrupted by concerns over visa uncertainties and potential discrimination.

title: Karur stampede: 27,000 gathered at TVK Vijay's rally meant for 10,000
content: Tamil Nadu DGP G. Venkataraman outlined the circumstances surrounding 40 deaths at a TVK meeting. While permission was for 3-10 pm, the party urged early gathering. Vijay's late arrival at 7:40 pm triggered a sudden surge, as nearly 27,000 people attended, far exceeding the expected 10,000. Police noted layout challenges, adding organizers shared crowd management responsibility.

title: New! More Suryavanshi in IPL? BCCI issues mandates for U-19, U-16 players
content: The BCCI has mandated that Under-19 and Under-16 players must play at least one First-Class match to be eligible for the IPL from the 2026 season. This policy, finalized on September 28, aims to strengthen domestic cricket by ensuring young talents develop technical skills and mental resilience in longer formats.

title: Will Aaron Rodgers play vs. Vikings today? Steelers QB ruled out with injury
content: Aaron Rodgers, now quarterback for the Pittsburgh Steelers, is set to face his former NFC North rival, the Minnesota Vikings, in Dublin. The 40-year-old, known for strong performances against Minnesota, will play without injury concerns. Carson Wentz starts for the Vikings as rookie J.J. McCarthy is sidelined, setting the stage for this international showdown.

title: Strong legs and longevity: 5 ways to train your legs to become steel strong
content: Strong legs are key to a long, healthy life. Greater thigh muscle mass reduces premature death risk. Powerful legs support mobility and prevent falls. They also boost circulation, benefiting heart and brain health. Simple exercises like squats and walking build strength. Consistency in training ensures lasting benefits. This approach helps maintain independence and sharp thinking as people age.

title: Empty UN: Bibi delivers speech as dozens of nations walkout
content: Israeli PM Netanyahu, in a defiant UN address, defended his nation's actions and pledged to "finish the job" against Hamas. He sharply criticised US allies for recognising a Palestinian state, labelling it a reward for terrorism and asserting Israel's refusal to accept a "terrorist state." Amid delegate walkouts, Netanyahu accused leaders of succumbing to pressure, while privately acknowledging Israel's intelligence.

title: How India vs Pak has seen drama in last fortnight - on and off the field
content: The Asia Cup witnessed an intense India-Pakistan cricket rivalry, marked by dramatic matches and significant off-field controversies. India secured victories in both group and Super 4s stages, leading to their historic first-ever final clash. Disputes included India's "no-handshake" policy, political dedications, and controversial gestures by Pakistani players, resulting in fines and protests.

title: '1 Cop For 50 People': Tamil Nadu Police Defends Deployment At TVK Chief Vijay's Rally
content: Tamil Nadu police have rejected allegations of inadequate deployment of personnel at Thamizhaga Vettri Kazhagam (TVK) chief and actor Vijay's rally in Karur, where a stampede left 40 people dead and nearly 100 injured on Saturday evening.

title: Opinion: Opinion | Cut The Politics, We Need Answers On Tamil Nadu Tragedy
content: Velusamypuram will remain a painful memory for Tamil Nadu. The scale of the tragedy that unfolded with the loss of 40 lives, including 10 children and several women, in a political gathering is gruesome, if not unprecedented.

title: What Is 'Clog The Toilet' Racist Campaign Against Indian H-1B Holders?
content: After Donald Trump announced a $100,000 fee for H-1B visas, panic spread among Indian tech workers, who scrambled to return to the US.

title: "We Didn't Run Away": DMK's Kanimozhi Jabs TVK Chief Vijay Over Stampede
content: A day after 40 people were killed and nearly 100 injured in a stampede at Tamilaga Vettri Kazhagam (TVK) chief Vijay's rally in Tamil Nadu's Karur district, DMK MP Kanimozhi took a jab at the popular actor-turned-politician.

title: Trainer Aircraft Skids Off Runway At Airport In Gujarat, Pilot Unhurt
content: A single-seater trainer aircraft skidded off the runway during landing at the Amreli airport in Gujarat on Sunday afternoon, though the trainee pilot was unhurt, officials said.

title: Madras High Court Cancels Urgent Hearing On Karur Stampede Tragedy
content: Madras High Court on Sunday cancelled its urgent hearing, scheduled for 4.30 p.m., on a plea related to the deadly stampede at actor-turned-politician Vijay's Tamilaga Vetri Kazhagam (TVK) rally in Tamil Nadu's Karur.

title: Self-Styled Godman Chaitanyananda Sent To 5-Day Police Custody By Delhi Court
content: A Delhi court on Sunday remanded Chaitanyananda Saraswati, a self-styled godman and a sexual harassment accused, to five days' police custody for questioning.

title: "My Party Will Either Be First Or Last": Prashant Kishor On Bihar Polls
content: In an exclusive interview with NDTV, Jan Suraaj chief Prashant Kishor made a significant claim about Bihar's politics. He said the Janata Dal (United), or JD(U), will win fewer than 25 seats in the upcoming assembly election.

title: Typhoon Bualoi Moves Toward Vietnam After Leaving 20 Dead In Philippines
content: Vietnam evacuated thousands of people from central and northern provinces Sunday as Typhoon Bualoi raced toward the country faster than expected with landfall forecast later in the day.

title: Himachal's Spiti Valley Recognised As India's First Cold Desert Biosphere Reserve
content: Himachal Pradesh's Spiti Valley in Lahaul-Spiti district has been recognised as India's first Cold Desert Biosphere Reserve under UNESCO's prestigious Man and the Biosphere (MAB) programme.

title: 'Don't Want Money, Give Sister Back': A Family Crushed By Stampede Tragedy
content: Brinda, a huge fan of actor-politician Vijay, was excited about the superstar's rally in Karur yesterday. She left her two-year-old son with her sister and headed to the venue, hoping to catch a glimpse of her hero

title: Ex-Chinese Minister Took $37 Million In Bribes, Sentenced To Death With Reprieve
content: Tang Renjian, China's former Minister of Agriculture and Rural Affairs, was sentenced to death with reprieve for bribery at a court in Jilin province on Sunday, according to state-run news agency Xinhua.

title: "She Went To See His Hero": Brother Of Woman Killed In Tamil Nadu Stampede
content: He brought his mother to the rally to get a glimpse of his hero, actor-turned-politician Vijay. His mother, Jaya, was caught in the stampede that killed 40, including her, as a crowd of thousands waited hours in hopes of seeing the actor Vijay.

title: AAP Launches 'Goa Doesn't Want BJP's Gundaraj' Campaign, Slams Rising Crime, Land Grabs
content: The Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) has launched a major statewide campaign in Goa, vowing to free the state from what it calls the Bharatiya Janata Party's (BJP) "Gundaraj", a reign of fear, crime, and lawlessness.

title: UP Man Kills Mother For Denying Him Money To Buy Liquor: Cops
content: A man has been arrested in Uttar Pradesh's Saharanpur for allegedly beating his 55-year-old mother to death over refusing to give him money to purchase alcohol, police said on Sunday.

title: A Two-Year-Old Among Victims Of Killer Stampede At Actor Vijay's Rally
content: At least 10 minors, including a two-year-old, are among the 39 victims of the stampede at actor-politician Vijay's rally in Karur yesterday. Many of them are women and most victims are in their 20s and 30s, NDTV has found.

title: "Tarnishing Image Against Constitution": Why Court Banned 'Surpanakha Dahan'
content: The Indore bench of the Madhya Pradesh High Court has stepped in to halt a controversial Dussehra event that had planned to replace Ravana with effigies of 11 women accused in criminal cases.

title: "Vijay Ignored People's Cry": Eyewitness' Claim Over TVK Rally Stampede
content: A power outage, a sudden surge of crowd, and a narrow space contributed to the stampede during actor-politician and TVK chief Vijay's rally in Tamil Nadu's Karur that left 39 people dead, eyewitnesses told NDTV.

title: Watch: Implications of Congress Working Committee meeting in Patna on Mahagathbandhan | Talking Politics
content: In this episode of Talking Politics, we will discuss the implications of CWC meeting held in Patna after 80 years on Mahagathbandhan allies.

title: Body of missing journalist recovered from lake in Uttarkashi
content: Senior journalist Rajiv Pratap’s body found in Uttarkashi lake, sparking grief and calls for investigation by officials

title: Nearly one lakh devotees throng Kanaka Durga temple for Maha Chandi darshan on Day 7 of Dasara
content: Ministers, senior officials, and MP join rituals as temple authorities enhance facilities, deploy technology, and prepare to accommodate up to 2 lakh pilgrims on September 29, coinciding with Mula Nakshatra, the goddess’s birth star

title: Government issues operational guidelines for tourism sector
content: The department says that these guidelines act like a rulebook that clarifies who can apply, what steps to follow, and how the government will process and release the benefits.

title: Karur stampede: ADGP denies stone pelting at Vijay’s rally, says sufficient police deployed for event
content: ADGP Devasirvatham said a detailed investigation will be carried out and also said around 500 police personnel led by the Superintendent of Police were deployed for bandobust for the event

title: Idols vandalised at community Durga puja in Tripura’s Gomati district
content: Police rule out conspiracy angle; security personnel deployed to maintain calm in Udaipur subdivision

title: TDB Vigilance recovers gold-plated tablets from sponsor’s relative’s house
content: A controversy had erupted in the run-up to the TDB-sponsored Global Ayyappa Sangamam, after the sponsor came on live television and alleged that his offering to the temple had gone missing since 2019

title: Ashok says there is no compulsion to provide personal information under Social and Educational Survey in Karnataka
content: Continuing his reservation against the ongoing Social and Educational Survey of the State government, Leader of the Opposition in the Assembly R. Ashok has maintained that there is no compulsion for people to provide personal information in the survey

title: Health Minister inaugurates DZBI.com in Anantapur
content: The online platform will bring together AYUSH doctors, hospitals, clinics, pharmacies, labs, and wellness seekers on a single digital interface, says Satya Kumar Yadav

title: Two teachers, one officer suspended for abstaining from survey duty in Davangere
content: These three were not only absent without valid reason but also failed to provide a satisfactory explanation

title: Dreams of two youngsters crushed in Karur rally stampede
content: M. Akash, 26, was an IT professional, and S. Gokulasri, 26, an M.Ed. graduate, was working as a guest lecturer at a college in Karur. They were trapped in the crowd and trampled to death

title: Bihar sitting on a time bomb of corruption, unemployment: Tejashwi Yadav
content: The RJD leader asks Chief Minister Nitish Kumar from where he will get additional funds to fulfil the promises made by his government ahead of Assembly polls

title: CPI(M) demands refund of ₹2,758 crore FPA charges to power consumers in Andhra Pradesh
content: Welcoming the ERC’s directive to refund ₹923 crore for the year 2024–25, the party says this alone is not enough, as consumers have already been burdened with an unjustified collection through monthly surcharge of 40 paise per unit under FPAC

title: History buffs embark on trip to iconic British-era stone rail arch bridge in Palakkad
content: The 165-year-old stone arch bridge across the Kalpathy river is among the oldest railway bridges in the country, holding significant historical value

title: Bareilly violence: Security remains heightened, neighbouring districts on high alert
content: Special police teams are working to arrest the remaining “rioters” involved in the clashes, said the officials

title: Samiti warns State govt. of intensifying agitation for pending crop insurance
content: Though the State government in March 2025 approved ₹667.73 crore of insurance claims to farmers, it has only released ₹340.99 crore of it

title: Despite respite from rain, Krishna and Bhima flowing with high quantum of water
content: It is because of heavy amount of outflow from Basavasagar Reservoir in Narayanpur and Gursunagi Bridge-cum-Barrage on the outskirts of Yadgir

title: Andhra Pradesh CM Chandrababu Naidu wishes Deputy CM Pawan Kalyan a speedy recovery
content: Naidu calls on Pawan, who has been down with high fever for the last few days, at his residence in Hyderabad and enquires about his health

title: Flood warnings issued as Krishna and Godavari rivers surge in Andhra Pradesh
content: Godavari at Dowleswaram and Bhadrachalam and Krishna at Prakasam Barrage rise to warning levels. APSDMA advises residents in low-lying areas to stay vigilant, avoid crossing flooded streams and roads, and follow official instructions

title: Sri Sathya Sai police launch initiative to tackle crimes against women, minors
content: SP instructs police personnel at all sub-divisions in the district to keep close watch on rowdy-sheeters and those booked for harassment, assault and sexual crimes

title: Karur stampede: Vijay’s Namakkal-Karur campaign was originally scheduled in December
content: He was originally supposed to campaign in north Chennai and Tiruvallur on September 27. However, the plan was revised a few days ago, advancing his Namakkal and Karur visit

title: APCC chief Sharmila has no right to criticise move to build temples with TTD funds, says BJP
content: What is your problem if Lord Venkateswara temples are constructed in Dalit colonies, BJP leader Sadineni Yamini Sarma questions the APCC chief

title: Crime Branch expands probe as Pallippuram man confesses to long-standing murder
content: The CB believes Bindhu was murdered in May 2006. Sebastian told investigators that the murder was carried out to extort ₹1.5 lakh, which Bindhu had received as an advance for the sale of her property in Ambalappuzha

title: Pasmanda Muslim body appeals for harmony, urges youth to refrain from action that may harm peace
content: It is clear that this controversy has been repeatedly raised to set a political agenda,” the All India Pasmanda Muslim Mahaz said

title: Watch: Israeli airstrikes and gunfire kill 44 people in Gaza
content: Israeli airstrikes and gunfire killed at least 44 people in Gaza on September 27, including entire families.

title: Congress to digitise archives of party records
content: Digital collection to include session reports since 1885, manifestos, leaders’ speeches, and rare volumes from Dr. Manmohan Singh Library

title: NDA government in Andhra Pradesh misleading public with false claims, alleges YSRCP MLC
content: Arun Kumar criticises government over farmers’ distress, medical college privatisation, and contradictory debt figures during Assembly and Council sessions

title: Andhra Pradesh Agriculture Department launches campaign on GST 2.0 reforms
content: As part of the initiative, awareness seminars, farm machinery exhibitions, and tractor rallies will be held at district, mandal, and RSK levels on September 30 and October 1, says official

title: Watch: Karur stampede: Police blame delay, overcrowding for 40 deaths
content: A stampede at actor-turned-politician Vijay’s rally in Karur, Tamil Nadu, has left 40 people dead and dozens injured. Police had warned organisers about risks and had deployed limited personnel, while organisers expected far fewer attendees.

title: Prioritise rescue, relief operations in flood-hit Kalyana Karnataka districts: Kumaraswamy appeals to Karnataka government
content: The Union minister urged the Karnataka govt to provide timely relief to farmers who have suffered severe crop loss and damage in Kalyana Karnataka districts.

title: Bypoll to Nuapada assembly seat in Odisha likely to be held along with Bihar elections: Election Commission of India
content: The by-election to the Nuapada Assembly constituency was necessitated due to the demise of sitting MLA Rajendra Dholakia on September 8 due to health-related issues

title: First India-born cheetah set to reach adulthood in Kuno National Park
content: Ready to contribute to increasing the cheetah population in India, says Project Cheetah Director Uttam Kumar Sharma

title: Two new antlion species discovered from Kerala
content: First species, Indophanes keralaensis, was identified from the forest regions of Sairandhri and Siruvani in Palakkad and Pampadum Shola National Park in Idukki. The second species, Indophanes sahyadriensis, was recorded from Siruvani in Palakkad, Pakshipathalam and Thirunelly in Wayanad, and Ranipuram in Kasaragod

title: ‘Give Ladakh a voice’: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi says UT’s people, culture, traditions under attack by BJP-RSS
content: Climate activist Sonam Wangchuk, the main voice behind the demand for statehood for Ladakh, has been detained under the National Security Act and lodged in Jodhpur jail in Rajasthan

title: 18th edition of Vembanad fish count in Kerala records 61 species
content: Oil deposits found spread across the water near Nazarath church at Kumarakom, resulting in very low fish availability. Decaying organic matter has been observed in various places

title: Jayanagar to soon get piped gas: MP Tejasvi Surya
content: The cost for PNG at SBI Layout in Bengaluru is estimated to be between ₹1.5 to ₹2 crore with GAIL providing the entire setup.

title: Undersea cable connectivity will position Mangaluru as global data centre hub, points out KDEM vision document
content: Establishing Mangaluru data centre hub is expected to create over 25,000 jobs, says Karnataka Digital Economy Mission

title: Government striving to get ‘Chhath Puja’ included in UNESCO’s cultural heritage list: PM Modi
content: “When Chhath Puja is included in the UNESCO list, people in every corner of the world will be able to experience its grandeur and divinity,” he said

title: Karur stampede: Body of TVK cadre brought to Salem
content: Tourism Minister R. Rajendran, Rajya Sabha MP S.R. Sivalingam and TVK functionaries paid their last respects and consoled the family members of the deceased

title: Election Commission to deploy 470 observers for Bihar Assembly polls, bypolls
content: A briefing of these observers is scheduled in New Delhi on October 3, a day before the EC visits Bihar to review poll preparedness

title: Three Maoists carrying total bounty of ₹14 lakh gunned down in Chhattisgarh
content: The gun battle took place on a forested hill near Chhindkhadak village along the border of Kanker and Gariaband districts

title: Karnataka floods: Siddaramaiah instructs officials to undertake rescue, relief operations in four districts of Kalyana Karnataka
content: The CM has told the Deputy Commissioners and Zilla Panchayat CEOs of the four Kalyana Karnataka districts to personally visit the flood-affected areas and take emergency measures.

title: Ouster of Central university Vice-Chancellor Shambhu Nath Singh sought in Northeast
content: The Tezpur University Teachers’ Association slams Shambhu Nath Singh for disrespectful remarks on Assam’s cultural icon, Zubeen Garg

title: Karur stampede: DMK MP submits petition seeking compensation for four TVK cadres in Namakkal
content: The four people are currently receiving medical treatment at private hospitals in Salem, Erode, Coimbatore, and Namakkal Government Medical College Hospital

title: MLA extends olive branch, reaches out to the Opposition
content: I believe that political rivalry can exist only during the elections and political leaders, irrespective of their party affiliations, are expected to work in tandem after that, says Nellore Rural MLA

title: Telangana Government committed to building Future City with global standards: CM Revanth Reddy
content: CM Revanth Reddy lays foundation for FCDA building asserting that Future City has all qualifications to be a global city

title: NDA leaders spread the message on GST 2.0 at the grassroots  level
content: The leaders explained how the move helped bring down the prices of as many as 83 commodities in the Indian market

title: Jagan Mohan Reddy, party MLAs face disqualification after 60 days of absence from Andhra Assembly
content: Yanamala Ramakrishnudu said Jagan Mohan Reddy and the other YSR Congress Party MLAs have to apply for leave of absence from the House

title: Maharashtra rains: NCP (SP) leader Jayant Patil writes to Governor, seeks three-day special Assembly session
content: Jayant Patil said he visited several flood-affected villages in Solapur, Dharashiv and Beed districts over the past two days and found that landless farm workers have suffered severe losses

title: Madhya Pradesh High Court bans burning of Meghalaya honeymoon murder accused Sonam Raghuvanshi's effigy on Dasara
content: 'Paurush', an Indore-based social organisation, said it was preparing an 11-headed effigy for ‘Surpanakha dahan’, which will feature images of women accused of heinous murders of their husbands, children, or in-laws

title: PM Modi to release postal stamp and coin to mark Rashtriya Swayamsewak Sangh’s centenary year
content: RSS, the ideological parent of ruling BJP, is completing its 100th year on the day of Vijayadashami falling on October 2, 2025 this year

title: Madurai Bench of Madras High Court to hear TVK’s case on September 29
content: Justices M. Dhandapani and M. Jothiraman accept a request made by a TVK lawyer for an urgent hearing of their plea regarding the Karur tragedy which claimed as many as 40 lives

title: Dharma has kept India united: Vice-President C.P. Radhakrishnan in Bihar
content: In his speech, the Vice-President also called Bihar’s Governor Arif Mohammed Khan “an old friend, since the days when both of us were members of Parliament”

title: Karnataka government empowered 1.2 lakh women, provided financial assistance of ₹50,000 crore in last two years: Shalini Rajneesh
content: The financial handholding has resulted in some 37% of women joining the labour force in the last couple of years, the Chief Secretary said.

title: Zubeen Garg’s family files complaint with Assam CID, wants his death probed
content: The CID’s Special Investigation Team visited the cultural icon’s residence in Guwahati to record statements

title: AIADMK reschedules Palaniswami’s campaign in Dharmapuri, Namakkal districts
content: As per the revised itinerary, Mr. Palaniswami will campaign in the Dharmapuri, Pappireddipatti, and Harur Assembly constituencies on October 2

title: Trawler capsizes off Goa coast; all 27 fishermen rescued
content: The India Meteorological Department (IMD) has issued a 'yellow alert', predicting heavy rains in Goa till October 1

title: Is Alabama back? Is Oregon the Big Ten's best? A raucous Week 5 reshuffled expectations
content: With four top-10 teams losing, Week 5 offered a reminder of just how little we know so early in a season.

title: Franklin takes 'ownership' of PSU loss to Ducks
content: Coach James Franklin, quarterback Drew Allar and the rest of the No. 3 Penn State Nittany Lions lost yet another game to a top-10 opponent, as the No. 6 Oregon Ducks posted a thrilling 30-24 victory in double overtime at Beaver Stadium.

title: Bethpage MC steps down over vulgar Rory chants
content: A master of ceremonies has stepped down from her role at the Ryder Cup after joining the Bethpage Black crowd in directing expletive-laced chants toward Rory McIlroy.

title: Bama upsets UGA, showing 'fight' after early loss
content: Alabama held on to beat No. 5 Georgia 24-21, handing the Bulldogs their first home loss in six years.

title: Europe holds historic lead, on brink of Ryder Cup
content: Europe is on the verge of retaining the Ryder Cup after a dominant Saturday left it just 2.5 points from victory over the United States at Bethpage Black.

title: Bryson, Rose, caddies get heated at Bethpage
content: The caddies for Bryson DeChambeau and Scottie Scheffler were involved in a confrontation with Europe's Justin Rose and Tommy Fleetwood during their four-ball match.

title: Kiffin's 'little, short' QB leads Rebels past LSU
content: Ole Miss quarterback Trinidad Chambliss, who didn't receive any Division I scholarships coming out of high school, helped the Rebels orchestrate a thrilling 24-19 victory over No. 4 LSU, keeping Lane Kiffin's team unbeaten at 5-0.

title: Lynx's Reeve suspended after blasting officiating
content: The WNBA suspended Lynx coach Cheryl Reeve for Sunday's Game 4 against the Mercury after her "conduct and comments" during and after Friday's Game 3 loss.

title: Guardians clinch playoff berth on walk-off HBP
content: The Guardians clinched a playoff berth after CJ Kayfus was hit by a pitch with the bases loaded in the ninth inning.

title: Atletico Madrid's big win over work-in-progress Real should kick-start their season

title: Liverpool had better learn from dramatic late defeat at unbeaten Crystal Palace

title: 🏀 Pearl steps down after 11 seasons at Auburn

content: Oklahoma State, which has lost 11 of 12 games since the start of the 2024 season, has fired head coach Mike Gundy, who was in his 21st season with the Cowboys.

title: Best plays of NFL Week 4: Steelers get TDs from Gainwell and Metcalf in Dublin
content: Sunday's Week 4 action is underway in Dublin, Ireland, where the  Minnesota Vikings  are facing the  Pittsburgh Steelers  this morning in the first international NFL game of 2025. 14 teams will be in action during the early set of afternoon games, headlined by the 3-0  Tampa Bay Buccaneers  hosting the 3-0  Philadelphia Eagles . We'll also see No. 1 pick QB  Cam Ward  and the 0-3  Tennessee Titans  at the 0-3  Houston Texans , as those teams look to get their first win. Rookie QB  Jaxson Dart  is set to make his first start for the 0-3  New York Giants  against the undefeated  Los Angeles Chargers . The late afternoon set of four games features the  Baltimore Ravens  heading west to face the  Kansas City Chiefs , as this pair of 1-2 championship contenders aim to gain some traction. And QB  Daniel Jones  and the surprising 3-0  Indianapolis Colts  are at the 2-1  Los Angeles Rams . Here are the top plays from Sunday, and be sure to keep checking back once the afternoon games kick off.
